usa: President Reagan proposes the Strategic Defense Initiative.<sup id="cite_ref-512" class="reference">[512]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-513" class="reference">[513]</sup>
1983 United States embassy bombing: The U.S. embassy in Beirut was bombed by members of the Islamic Jihad Organization (IJO), killing 63 people, including 17 U.S. government personnel.[514]
Beirut barracks bombing: 241 United States Marine Corps personnel were killed in a suicide bombing by members of the IJO in Lebanon.[515]
Operation Urgent Fury: Under executive action from President Reagan, the U.S. deployed 1,900 military personnel in the Invasion of Grenada.[516]
india: N. T. Rama Rao NTR's 9 month old Telugu Desam Comes in to Power in AP marks a new Challenger post Loknayak Jayprakash Narayan against Indira
australia: The Ash Wednesday bushfires kill 71 people.
Australian federal election, 1983: Bob Hawke defeats Fraser and leads Labor back to government.
argentina: Military government collapsed; election of Radical Raúl Alfonsín as president
albania: Hoxha began his retirement, leaving more administrative power to Alia.
